input_text:
Job Title: Vendor Management Analyst II

Location: Detroit, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Overview

Why GMF Technology?

GM Financial is set to change the auto finance industry and is leading the path of embarking on tech modernization - we have a startup mindset, and preserve our small company culture, in a public company environment with financial stability and intense growth over a decade-long history. We are data junkies and trust in data and insights to advance our business objectives.

We take our goal of zero emission, zero collision, zero congestion, and zero friction very seriously. We believe as the auto finance market leader we are in the driver's seat to lead us in the GM EV mission to change the world.

We are building global platforms, LATAM, Europe, China - and we are looking to grow our high-performing team. GMF is comprised of over 10,000 team members globally. Join our fintech culture within a Blue-Chip company where we are changing the way we use technology to support our customers and business.

Responsibilities

About this role:

Be a part of GM's vision to create a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion. The Vendor Management Analyst II is responsible for the governance oversight and support of vendor activities to achieve the goals and objects of the organization. This position works with internal stakeholders and external vendors to oversee regulatory and contractual obligations are met. The Vendor Management Analyst II ensures all applicable department and global policy requirements are met.

Job Duties

Cost of engagementReview existing vendor contracts and upon renewal, if we do renew, recommend adjustments to align with the existing preferred vendor contracts.Build a strong relationship with the vendors performing IT delivery work for GMFAssist in the design and development of vendor management processesServe as the Liaison between the vendor and internal stakeholders and assist with issue resolutionCoordinate with the GMF leadership teams to gather performance feedback on the vendors for each engagement.Provide feedback to the vendors on a quarterly basis/ each engagement regarding their performance with areas for improvement.Design, create and operationalize a new vendor performance management framework / scorecard to bring visibility on our vendors 

Qualifications

What makes you a dream candidate?

Knowledge And Skills

Self-motivated person with the ability to accept and drive changeExcellent Organizational skillsMust be adaptable, open to collaboration and a team playerAble to build customer loyalty, relationships, and trustContinuous improvement and change agentMust be familiar with vendor management and relationship concepts, practices, and proceduresAbility to perform comprehensive analysis on costs and benefits of project proposals and outsourcing activitiesSelf-motivated person with the ability to embrace role and drive changeAbility to communicate effectively at multiple levels of an organization (verbal and written) on a regular basisProven analytical skills and strategic thinkingMust be skilled and highly proficient with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)

Experience And Education

3-5 years in a Vendor Management Department, Purchasing Department or functionally related area requiredHigh School Diploma requiredAssociate Degree in related field of vendor management, accounting or finance or 3+ years of experience in the field or in a related area preferredBachelor’s Degree in related field of vendor management, accounting or finance or 3+ years of experience in the field or in a related area preferredMaster’s Degree in related field of vendor management, accounting or finance or 3+ years of experience in the field or in a related area preferred

What We Offer: Generous benefits package available on day one to include: 401K matching, bonding leave for new parents (12 weeks, 100% paid), tuition assistance, training, GM employee auto discount, community service pay and nine company holidays.

Our Culture: Our team members define and shape our culture — an environment that welcomes innovative ideas, fosters integrity, and creates a sense of community and belonging. Here we do more than work — we thrive.

Compensation: Competitive pay and bonus eligibility.

Work Life Balance: Flexible hybrid work environment, 2 days a week in the office.

Salary

The base salary range for this role is: USD $54,000.00 to $100,000.00. At GM Financial, we strive for transparency in all aspects of our business, including pay equity. This is the GM Financial pay range for this role and job level. The exact salary and compensation will vary based on factors like knowledge, skills, experience, and education. This role is eligible to participate in a performance-based incentive plan. Full time employees are eligible to participate in health benefits on day one of employment.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
